definitions.definition: Any of the military expeditions undertaken by the Christians of Europe in the 11th to 13th centuries to reconquer the Levant from the Muslims.
definitions.example: During the crusades, many Muslims and Christians and Jews were slaughtered.

definitions.definition: Any war instigated and blessed by the Church for alleged religious ends. Especially, papal sanctioned military campaigns against infidels or heretics.
A grand concerted effort toward some purportedly worthy cause.
A mass gathering in a political campaign or during a religious revival effort.
To go on a military crusade.
To make a grand concerted effort toward some purportedly worthy cause.
definitions.example: He crusaded against similar injustices for the rest of his life.
